label: 田使
本: The Emergence of Japanese Kingship . Stanford University Press . 1997
説明文: a field manager, generally for a royal estate (miyake) in the preritsuryō period. The term first appears in Kimmei's chapter in the Nihon shoki, in connection with Soga reorganization of the royal fisc. The tazukai oversaw cultivation by royal cultivators (tabe) whose names were recorded in registers called seki. [屯倉（みやけ）、欽明、日本書紀、蘇我、田部、籍]
